platforms.name: OpenAI Whisper
platforms.description: OpenAI Whisper is an open-source automatic speech recognition (ASR) system that transcribes and translates speech from audio across dozens of languages. It is designed to be robust to accents, background noise, and technical language, making it highly versatile. Its unique value lies in being a state-of-the-art, general-purpose model that is freely available for both research and commercial use, trained on a massive and diverse 680,000-hour dataset.
keyFeatures: Speech translation from non-English languages to English
Robust performance in noisy environments and with diverse accents

platforms.name: Kaldi
platforms.description: Kaldi is an open-source speech recognition toolkit designed for both research and production environments. It provides a comprehensive framework for building speech recognition systems with state-of-the-art techniques, featuring extensive support for custom acoustic and language model training. What makes Kaldi unique is its robust C++ core with efficient WFST-based decoding, extensive documentation of research methods, and its role as a foundational codebase that has influenced many commercial and academic speech systems.
keyFeatures: WFST-based decoder for efficient speech recognition
Extensive C++ library for speech processing algorithms
Support for DNN, TDNN, and CNN acoustic models

platforms.name: OpenVoice 2
platforms.description: OpenVoice 2 is an advanced, open-source instant voice cloning and real-time voice conversion engine developed by MyShell. It enables users to clone a voice from a short audio sample and generate speech with precise control over style, emotion, accent, rhythm, and intonation. Its unique capability to separate and independently control timbre (voice identity) from other speech parameters makes it a powerful and flexible tool for developers, content creators, and researchers in the voice AI space.
keyFeatures: Instant voice cloning from a short audio sample (no extensive training required)
Real-time voice conversion and text-to-speech synthesis
Fine-grained control over style (e.g., sarcasm, whispering), emotion, accent, rhythm, and pauses

platforms.name: OpenVoice 2
platforms.description: OpenVoice 2 is an advanced, open-source instant voice cloning toolkit developed by MyShell that enables users to replicate any voice from a short audio sample in near real-time. Its key capabilities include unprecedented fine-grained control over emotional tone, accent, rhythm, and speech style, making it a powerful tool for creating highly realistic and expressive synthetic speech. What sets it apart is its ability to perform cross-lingual voice cloning—allowing a cloned voice to speak in languages not present in the original sample—while maintaining a completely open-source and accessible framework for developers and researchers.
keyFeatures: Instant voice cloning from less than 2 seconds of audio input
Fine-grained control over emotion (e.g., happy, sad, whispering), accent, rhythm, pauses, and intonation
Cross-lingual voice cloning enabling speech in languages not in the original sample
